title: Phase 2: Gateway & Database Configuration
description:
## Goal
Configure multi-agent routing in gateway and create SQLite coordination tables.

## Prerequisites (Complete)
- Phase 1 done: Agent workspaces exist at ~/clawd/agents/{main,landos,rangeos,ops}/
- SOUL.md and HEARTBEAT.md files created for all 4 agents
- AGENTS.md operating manual at ~/clawd/shared/
- SSH access working: `ssh pops-claw`

## Requirements (10 total)

### Gateway (GW-01 to GW-05)
- [ ] GW-01: Backup existing clawdbot.json
- [ ] GW-02: Add agent routes (4 agents)
- [ ] GW-03: Configure staggered heartbeats (15min, 2min offset: :00, :02, :04, :06)
- [ ] GW-04: Map Slack channels (#clawdbot→main, #land-ops→landos, #range-ops→rangeos, #ops→ops)
- [ ] GW-05: Restart gateway and verify

### Database (DB-01 to DB-05)
- [ ] DB-01: Create agent_tasks table (id, agent_id, title, status, priority, beads_issue_id, timestamps)
- [ ] DB-02: Create agent_messages table (from_agent, to_agent, message_type, subject, body, read_at)
- [ ] DB-03: Create agent_activity table (agent_id, activity_type, summary, created_at)
- [ ] DB-04: Create indexes for efficient queries
- [ ] DB-05: Verify database accessible from agent workspaces

## Key Files
- Config: ~/.clawdbot/clawdbot.json
- Database: ~/clawd/coordination.db (new SQLite)
- Plans: .planning/phases/ (Phase 2 plans TBD)

## Agent Roster
| ID | Name | Domain | Heartbeat | Channel |
|----|------|--------|-----------|---------|
| main | Andy | Coordinator | :00 | #clawdbot |
| landos | Scout | Land Investing | :02 | #land-ops |
| rangeos | Vector | UAS Ops | :04 | #range-ops |
| ops | Sentinel | Infrastructure | :06 | #ops |

## Access
- EC2: ssh pops-claw (100.72.143.9)
- Tailscale required

## Notes
- SQLite chosen over Convex for simplicity
- Slack channels #land-ops, #range-ops, #ops need to be created (Phase 3)
- This phase focuses on gateway config + database schema only
close_reason: All 10 requirements complete: 4 agent routes, channel bindings, heartbeat cron jobs, SQLite coordination.db with 3 tables + indexes

title: Phase 27 Task 4: Confirm 48h rua DMARC aggregate report
description:
## Context
Phase 27 (Email Domain Hardening) Tasks 1-3 complete. DMARC escalated to p=quarantine on 2026-02-19T20:13:25Z. Readiness gate activated. WARMUP.md Steps 1-4 COMPLETE, Step 5 IN PROGRESS.

## What to do
**Earliest:** 2026-02-21 ~3:13 PM EST (48h after escalation)

1. Check theandykaufman@gmail.com → 'DMARC Reports' label for aggregate report(s) for mail.andykaufman.net
2. Confirm at least 1 report arrived with zero DMARC failures (dkim=pass, spf=pass)
3. Check morning briefing Section 9 — bounce <2%, complaint <0.08%
4. If clean: run /gsd:execute-phase 27 to resume — executor picks up from Task 4 checkpoint
5. On approval, continuation agent SSHes to EC2 and marks WARMUP.md Step 5 COMPLETE
6. Phase 27 closes → verifier runs → Phase 29 gate countdown continues (7 days total from escalation)

## Key files (EC2)
- email-config.json: dmarc_escalated_at=2026-02-19T20:13:25Z, dmarc_policy=quarantine
- WARMUP.md: Steps 1-4 COMPLETE, Step 5 awaiting 48h confirmation
- SUMMARY.md: .planning/phases/27-email-domain-hardening/27-01-SUMMARY.md (partial — Tasks 1-3)

## If issues
- No reports arrived: check DNS with dig TXT _dmarc.mail.andykaufman.net — confirm rua=mailto:theandykaufman@gmail.com
- Reports show failures: investigate which messages failed and why before approving

title: Phase 3: Slack Channels & Agent Testing
description:
## Goal
Create Slack channels and test multi-agent routing end-to-end.

## Prerequisites (Complete)
- Phase 2 done: Gateway configured with 4 agents + bindings
- SQLite coordination.db created with 3 tables
- Heartbeat cron jobs configured (15min staggered)

## Requirements (8 total)

### Slack Channels (SC-01 to SC-03) ✅
- [x] SC-01: Create #land-ops channel in Slack
- [x] SC-02: Create #range-ops channel in Slack
- [x] SC-03: Create #ops channel in Slack
- Note: Main channel changed from #clawdbot to #popsclaw
- Fix: Bindings required channel IDs not names

### Agent Testing (AT-01 to AT-05)
- [x] AT-01: Test main agent responds in #popsclaw
- [x] AT-02: Test landos agent responds in #land-ops
- [x] AT-03: Test rangeos agent responds in #range-ops
- [x] AT-04: Test ops agent responds in #ops
- [ ] AT-05: Test inter-agent messaging via coordination.db

## Agent Roster
| ID | Name | Channel | Channel ID |
|----|------|---------|------------|
| main | Andy | #popsclaw | C0AD48J8CQY |
| landos | Scout | #land-ops | C0AD4842LJC |
| rangeos | Vector | #range-ops | C0AC3HB82P5 |
| ops | Sentinel | #ops | C0AD485E50Q |

## Access
- EC2: ssh pops-claw (100.72.143.9)
- Slack: AK's workspace
close_reason: Phase 3 complete. All Slack channels created, all 4 agents respond correctly in their channels. Inter-agent messaging via coordination.db verified - cron jobs fixed, test message inserted. Heartbeat pickup confirmed working at next scheduled run.

title: Fix n8n Svix signature verification and complete Phase 20 E2E test
Clear EC2 user-data on next stop
description: Instance has a #cloud-boothook that disables UFW on every boot. Band-aid: ufw-reenable.service re-enables after cloud-init. On next stop: (1) In CloudShell: aws ec2 modify-instance-attribute --instance-id i-061e95ba4dd5e981b --user-data Value= (2) SSH in: sudo systemctl disable ufw-reenable.service && sudo rm /etc/systemd/system/ufw-reenable.service

title: Phase 4: Cron/Scheduled Tasks
description: Enable cron + wakeups feature, configure webhooks, set up recurring automations, test heartbeat

title: Phase 2: Email/Calendar Integration (Gmail)
description:
## Goal
Enable OpenClaw to read/summarize emails and manage calendar on a Gmail account.

## Prerequisites
- Google Cloud project with Gmail API and Calendar API enabled
- OAuth 2.0 credentials (Desktop app type)
- User's Gmail account to integrate

## Implementation Steps

### 1. Google Cloud Setup
- Create project at console.cloud.google.com
- Enable Gmail API and Google Calendar API
- Create OAuth 2.0 credentials (Desktop application)
- Download credentials JSON

### 2. OpenClaw Configuration
- SSH to EC2: `ssh -i ~/.ssh/clawdbot-key.pem ubuntu@100.72.143.9`
- Add Gmail plugin config to ~/.clawdbot/clawdbot.json
- Set up OAuth token storage

### 3. Gmail Pub/Sub (Real-time notifications)
- Create Pub/Sub topic in Google Cloud
- Grant Gmail publish permissions
- Configure webhook endpoint or polling

### 4. Testing
- Test email read access
- Test calendar read/write
- Verify real-time notifications work

## Key Questions to Ask User
1. Which Google account for Gmail/Calendar?
2. What scopes needed? (read-only vs full access)
3. Should agent be able to send emails or just read?

## References
- OpenClaw docs: https://openclaw.ai/
- Gmail API: https://developers.google.com/gmail/api
- EC2 access: 100.72.143.9 via Tailscale
- SSH key: ~/.ssh/clawdbot-key.pem
close_reason: Gmail and Calendar integration complete. OAuth configured, gog CLI working, clawdbot hooks configured. Push notifications deferred to cron polling.

title: Phase 2: Gmail Integration
description: Gmail Pub/Sub integration complete. Account: theandykaufman@gmail.com. Push endpoint: https://ip-172-31-7-127.tail26c537.ts.net:8443/gmail-pubsub
close_reason: Complete. Gmail integration working - test email triggered agent successfully.

title: Plan and execute Phase 19: Outbound Email Foundation
description:
## Context
v2.2 Resend Email Integration, Phase 19 (first phase).

## Goal
Bob sends email via custom SKILL.md + curl + Resend REST API from Docker sandbox.

## Key Files
- Roadmap: .planning/milestones/v2.2-ROADMAP.md
- Research: .planning/research/ (ARCHITECTURE.md, FEATURES.md, STACK.md, PITFALLS.md, SUMMARY.md)
- Phase dir: .planning/phases/19-outbound-email-foundation/

## Research Decisions (already locked in)
- Custom SKILL.md + curl (NOT MCP — OpenClaw ignores mcpServers)
- RESEND_API_KEY injected via openclaw.json agents.defaults.sandbox.docker.env
- Subdomain for sending domain (protect root MX)
- Add Auto-Submitted: auto-generated header to ALL outbound
- Morning briefing via email cron (reuse existing content)

## Expected Plans (~2)
1. Resend account + domain DNS + API key config (openclaw.json + .env)
2. resend-email SKILL.md + briefing email cron + smoke test

## Success Criteria
1. Domain verified (SPF/DKIM pass)
2. Bob sends test email from Slack command
3. Morning briefing delivered via email
4. Auto-Submitted header on all outbound

## Steps
1. /gsd:plan-phase 19 (creates plans from research)
2. /gsd:execute-phase 19 (SSH to EC2, deploy skill + config)
3. Verify end-to-end

## Notes
- No research phase needed — same pattern as Oura/Govee/receipt-scanner
- User must create Resend account + provide API key manually
- DNS changes are manual (user does in registrar)
- EC2 SSH: ubuntu@100.72.143.9 via ~/.ssh/clawdbot-key.pem

title: Complete Ezra pipeline test: merge worktree, add CA66 media, verify end-to-end
description:
## Context

Full Ezra content pipeline test is IN PROGRESS. Here's what's done and what remains.

### DONE
- content.db schema upgraded: added body, wp_post_id, wp_url, published_at to articles; category to topics; created social_posts table
- BVLOS article (id:2) has full 2400-word HTML body, status=approved, scores 8.5/9.0/8.7
- WordPress draft created: Post ID 1572, URL https://airspaceintegration.com/?p=1572
- Social posts generated: LinkedIn (1248 chars), X/Twitter (3-tweet thread), Instagram (caption + image prompt) — all in social_posts table
- /content page updated with SocialPosts section (merged feat/ezra-pipeline → main on EC2)
- Pipeline metrics fixed: maps actual agent statuses (draft/writing/review) to display buckets
- content.db seeded with 21 topics + 12 articles across all pipeline stages

### TODO
1. Add CA66 media (LiDAR, GeoTIFFs, photos from Trinity F90+ flights on external drives + Google Drive) as hero images for WP draft and Instagram
2. Clean up EC2 worktree: git worktree remove ~/clawd/mission-control-ezra (already merged)
3. Verify Ezra's publish-check cron detects the WP draft correctly on next run (daily 2pm PT)
4. Test content.db ownership for Docker sandbox writes — fixed to ubuntu:ubuntu but may revert if gateway restarts (root-owned containers)
5. Consider adding wp_url column to ArticlePipeline dashboard component (show WP draft link for approved articles)

### Key References
- WordPress creds in ~/.openclaw/.env (WP_SITE_URL, WP_USERNAME, WP_APP_PASSWORD)
- Worktree: ~/clawd/mission-control-ezra (feat/ezra-pipeline branch, already merged to main)
- content.db: ~/clawd/agents/main/content.db (owned by ubuntu, 664 perms)
- Skills: ~/.openclaw/skills/wordpress-publisher/ and ~/.openclaw/skills/social-promoter/
- Ezra workspace: ~/clawd/agents/ezra/

### Worktree Pattern
Established git worktree workflow for Mission Control development:
- Production: ~/clawd/mission-control/ (main branch, serves dashboard)
- Feature work: ~/clawd/mission-control-<feature>/ (feature branch, safe to break)
- Symlink node_modules from main (don't commit the symlink)
- Merge to main when build passes, then rebuild + restart service
close_reason: Items 2-5 completed. Item 1 (CA66 media) deferred. Worktree cleaned, publish-check verified, content.db ownership OK, wp_url added to dashboard, stale content.db path fixed.

title: Test Gmail read/send functionality
close_reason: Gmail read/search and Calendar access verified via gog CLI

title: Voice-memory-v2 processing pipeline stuck after Supabase restore
description: After unpausing Supabase project (fxrmpizgvffylhifyhyn), note processing is stuck. Notes upload successfully but don't progress past 'uploaded' status. Whisper transcription + GPT-4o analysis pipeline not firing. Affects: Hainline Rd 141.m4a (b960b933) and a short recording (25cffbcf, stuck at 'queued'). User ID changed after restore: now 8a012b66-e058-48d9-8e22-b750815cd743 (was da9fdfd3). Process API at /api/notes/{id}/process requires auth. Check Vercel function logs for errors. This blocks the voice→priorities→Bob pipeline.

title: Phase 6: Production Hardening
description: Set up monitoring/alerting, log rotation, recovery procedures, final security review

title: Execute Phase 26 Plan 02: Backfill baseline, OBSERVABILITY.md, morning briefing section 10
description:
## Context
Phase 26 (Agent Observability) Wave 1 is DONE — Plan 26-01 shipped the observability-hooks plugin on EC2. Wave 2 (Plan 26-02) was interrupted before execution.

## What's Done
- observability-hooks plugin installed at ~/.openclaw/plugins/observability-hooks/
- Hooks fire on llm_output and agent_end events across all 7 agents
- observability.db exists at ~/clawd/agents/main/observability.db with llm_calls + agent_runs tables
- DB bind-mounted read-only into sandbox at /workspace/observability.db
- Gateway stable, verified with heartbeat cron (1 LLM call + 1 agent run recorded)

## What Remains (Plan 26-02, 2 tasks)

### Task 1: Backfill baseline + create OBSERVABILITY.md
- Parse cron JSONL at ~/.openclaw/cron/runs/*.jsonl to backfill observability.db with historical data
- Write Python script to extract model/tokens/duration/agent from JSONL entries, INSERT into tables
- Create ~/clawd/agents/main/OBSERVABILITY.md reference doc with SQL queries for 6 reporting areas
- Expected 500-2000 historical rows from ~2.2MB of JSONL

### Task 2: Add Section 10 to morning briefing cron
- Update morning briefing cron (ID: 863587f3-bb4e-409b-aee2-11fe2373e6e0) jobs.json message
- Add '## 10. Agent Observability' section pointing to OBSERVABILITY.md
- Restart gateway, verify test run produces observability section

## How to Execute
Run: /gsd:execute-phase 26
The workflow will detect 26-01 SUMMARY.md exists and skip to 26-02 automatically.

## After 26-02 Completes
Phase verification runs automatically. Then phases 27-29 remain in v2.4.
